attributes.title: Mapping Assignment: Rory Campbell
attributes.description: This assignment shows the mapping of Starbucks coffee. Starbucks buys coffee beans from several countries under their "ethical" coffee program. Coffee beans are picked and processed in these several countries then shipped to Canada as well as other countries than on to one of Starbucks 17,000 locations. Finally the coffee beans are processed into coffee at one of these locations and the coffee is enjoyed by over 50,000,000 people everyday.
Final stop, wear I enjoy the coffee beans that have been turned into delicious over priced gourmet coffee.
attributes.title: Barrie Starbucks

attributes.description: Where the coffee beans are shipped to from across the globe.
attributes.title: Starbucks Ontario Warehouse

attributes.description: Indonesia picks, refines and packages coffee beans for Starbucks. These packaged coffee beans are sent to Starbucks warehouses and than to Starbucks franchises.
attributes.title: Coffee Production (6)

attributes.description: China produces, processes and packages coffee beans so they can be shipped for use in Starbucks franchise locations.
attributes.title: Coffee Production (5)

attributes.description: Kenyan coffee bean farms pick, process and packages Starbucks coffee and ship it out to countries with Starbucks franchises.
attributes.title: Coffee Production (4)

attributes.description: Brazil produces and ships out Starbucks coffee beans. Brazil is one of Starbucks ethical coffee manufacturers
attributes.title: Coffee Production

attributes.description: Columbia produces ethical Starbucks coffee beans. These beans are picked and processed in Columbia before they are shipped out in bulk.
attributes.title: Coffee Bean Production (2)

attributes.description: Starbucks gets coffee beans from ethical Mexican coffee producers, the coffee is picked processed on site or in the same region before it is shipped out.
